gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਅਵਗਾਹਨ ਕੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਿ ਅਾਤਮ ਤਰੰਗ ਗੰਗ ਸਾਗਰ ਲਹਰਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Avagaahan Kai Saadhasangi , Aatam Tarang Gang Saagar Lahari Hai ?
translation: When a Sikh joins in the holy congregation and become engrossed in the divine word, the ecstasy of the spiritual waves felt by him is like the waves of the ocean.

gurmukhi: ਅਗਮ ਅਥਾਹਿ ਅਾਹਿ ਅਪਰ ਅਪਾਰ ਅਤਿ ਰਤਨ ਪ੍ਰਗਾਸ ਨਿਧਿ ਪੂਰਨ ਗਹਰਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Agam Adaahi Aahi Apar Apaar Ati , Ratan Pragaas Nidhi Pooran Gahari Hai ?
translation: The ocean-like Lord is beyond our reach and its depth is unfathomable. One who stays engrossed in Naam Simran and adulations of the Lord is able to realise the jewel-like treasure of the Almighty.

gurmukhi: ਹੰਸ ਮਰਜੀਵਾ ਗੁਨ ਗਾਹਕ ਚਾਹਕ ਸੰਤ ਨਿਸ ਦਿਨ ਘਟਿਕਾ ਮਹੂਰਤ ਪਹਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Hans Marajeevaa Goun Gaahak Chaahak Santa , Nis Din Ghatikaa Mahoorat Pahar Hai ?
translation: The true disciple and seeker of the Lord remains a trader for the jewel-like traits of the Lord's name and he is never affected by the time of the day or night, watch, auspiciousness of the time and other rites and rituals.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਵਾਂਤ ਬੂੰਦ ਬਰਖਾ ਜਿੳੁ ਗਵਨ ਘਟਾ ਘਮੰਡ ਹੋਤ ਮੁਕਤਾਹਲ ਅੳੁ ਨਰ ਨਰਹਰ ਹੈ ॥੭੬॥
transliteration: Svaant Boond Barakhaa Jiu Gavan Ghataa Ghamanda , Hot Moukataahal Au Nar Narahar Hai ?76?
translation: As the Swati raindrop becomes a precious pearl when it falls on a clam in the deep sea, similarly when a Sikh experiences the divine unstruck music in the tenth opening (Dasam Duar) as a result of Naam Simran, he becomes God from the form of a human being
